Class ConsoleView

java.lang.Object
view.ConsoleView
public class ConsoleView extends Object
ConsoleView

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ConsoleView()
    Constructs a ConsoleView instance and initializes the Scanner for reading user input from the standard input stream (System.in).

  • Constructor Details

    • ConsoleView

      public ConsoleView()
      Constructs a ConsoleView instance and initializes the Scanner for reading user input from the standard input stream (System.in). This Scanner will be used for all user interactions in the console-based interface.

  • Method Details

    • displayMainMenu

      public void displayMainMenu()
      Displays the main menu for the JavaJeeps coffee truck management system. This menu provides the user with the following options: 1. Create a new coffee truck 2. Manage existing trucks 3. View the business dashboard 0. Exit the program This method is typically invoked at the start of the program or when returning to the main screen.

    • displayCreateTruck

      public void displayCreateTruck()
      Displays the menu for creating a new coffee truck. Provides the user with the option to create either a Regular Truck (JavaJeep) or a Special Truck (JavaJeep+). Also includes an option to exit the menu.

    • displaySetTruckLoc

      public void displaySetTruckLoc()
      Prompts the user to enter a location for a newly created coffee truck. This method outputs a single line asking the user to input a location string.

    • displayExistingTrucks

      public void displayExistingTrucks(CoffeeBusiness business)
      Displays a list of existing coffee trucks managed by the business. Each truck is listed with its corresponding index number and location. The user can select a truck to manage or choose to exit the menu.
      Parameters:
      business - the CoffeeBusiness instance containing the list of trucks

    • displayTruckInteractions

      public void displayTruckInteractions()
      Displays the menu for available truck interactions. Allows the user to: 1. Simulate coffee sales with the selected truck 2. View truck information including type, location, and inventory 3. Restock or maintain the truck's inventory 4. Update or view the price list of drinks 0. Exit the truck interaction menu

    • displayTruckInfo

      public void displayTruckInfo(CoffeeBusiness business, CoffeeTruck truck, int truckNo)
      Displays the information of a specific coffee truck. This includes the truck number, type, and location. It also shows the menu prices and the current inventory status of the truck.
      Parameters:
      business - the CoffeeBusiness instance managing the truck
      truck - the CoffeeTruck instance whose details are being displayed
      truckNo - the numerical identifier of the truck (1-based index)

    • displayRestockTruck

      public void displayRestockTruck(CoffeeTruck truck)
      Displays the current inventory status of a coffee truck. For each bin in the truck, this method shows the item name, quantity, and unit. If the bin contains cups, the quantity is displayed without decimals. Empty bins are labeled as "Empty".
      Parameters:
      truck - the CoffeeTruck instance whose inventory is being displayed

    • displayRestockItem

      public void displayRestockItem(int binNo)
      Prompts the user to set the content of a specific storage bin. This message is shown during the restocking process to ask for the item type to be placed in the specified bin.
      Parameters:
      binNo - the bin number (1-based index) being configured

    • displayRestockQuantity

      public void displayRestockQuantity(int binNo)
      Prompts the user to input the quantity for a specific bin. This message is shown after selecting the item to restock, asking the user to input the amount of the item to be added to the bin.
      Parameters:
      binNo - the bin number (1-based index) being restocked

    • displayRestockLegend

      public void displayRestockLegend()
      Displays the legend of valid input options for restocking bins. This legend includes all valid item codes that the user can enter to restock a bin. Each code corresponds to a specific ingredient or cup size, including: - C: Coffee Beans - F: Full Cream Milk - W: Water - S: Small Cup - M: Medium Cup - L: Large Cup - E: Empty Box (to clear the bin)

    • displayDashboard

      public void displayDashboard(CoffeeBusiness business)
      Displays the full business dashboard for the JavaJeeps coffee truck system. This includes the following sections: - Total number of trucks, including breakdown by truck type (regular and special) - List of truck locations - Combined sales revenue from all trucks, broken down by drink type and total revenue - Aggregate inventory from all trucks, grouped by item name, quantity, and unit The method manually aggregates inventory without using hash maps by maintaining parallel ArrayLists for item names, quantities, and units.
      Parameters:
      business - the CoffeeBusiness instance containing all trucks and transaction data

    • displayPricingHeader

      public void displayPricingHeader()
      Displays the header section for the pricing table. This method prints a formatted table header used in price display menus, including columns for Drink, Size, and Price.

    • displayUpdatePrices

      public void displayUpdatePrices(CoffeeBusiness business)
      Displays the menu for updating drink prices. This method shows the list of drinks with their corresponding sizes and prices, prefixed with selection indices to allow user input for updating a specific entry.
      Parameters:
      business - the CoffeeBusiness instance containing the drink price list

    • displayPrices

      public void displayPrices(CoffeeBusiness business)
      Displays the current drink prices offered by the business. This method shows a formatted table of all drinks including their names, sizes, and prices. It does not include selection indices.
      Parameters:
      business - the CoffeeBusiness instance containing the drink price list

    • displayReceipt

      public void displayReceipt(CoffeeBusiness business, CoffeeTruck truck, int input, double total)
      Displays a formatted receipt for a successfully completed coffee order. The receipt includes the truck's location, the name and size of the drink ordered, and the total price of the transaction.
      Parameters:
      business - the CoffeeBusiness instance containing the drink price list
      truck - the CoffeeTruck instance that processed the order
      input - the index of the selected drink in the price list (0-based)
      total - the final price of the order to be shown on the receipt

    • displayCancelledOrder

      public void displayCancelledOrder()
      Displays a cancellation message for an unsuccessful coffee order. This message indicates that the order could not be completed due to missing or insufficient ingredients in the truck's inventory and advises the user to restock.

    • getMenuInput

      public int getMenuInput()
      Prompts the user to input a numeric menu option. This method reads an integer input from the user, validating it to ensure that only numeric values are accepted. If the input is invalid, it prompts the user again.
      Returns:
      the validated integer input from the user

    • getTextInput

      public String getTextInput()
      Reads and returns a line of text input from the user. This method uses the scanner to read the next full line entered by the user.
      Returns:
      the user input as a string

    • getNumInput

      public double getNumInput()
      Reads and returns a numeric input (double) from the user. The method repeatedly prompts the user until a valid decimal number is entered. After reading input, it flushes the buffer to avoid input skipping issues.
      Returns:
      the validated double value entered by the user

    • getIntInput

      public int getIntInput()
      Reads and returns an integer input from the user. The method continues to prompt the user until a valid integer is entered. After each attempt, it flushes the scanner buffer to prevent input issues.
      Returns:
      the validated integer value entered by the user
